clues.text: Joint military exercises like the ones the U.S. conducts with South Korea also have this more playful name
The first world mind sports games, Beijing 2008, included chess, checkers & this card game
These games held in Rio in 2007 & slated for Guadalajara in 2011, outlived the similarly named airline
These games for athletes with physical disabilities began in Rome in 1960
These are held wherever Scottish culture has spread, like Maxville, Ontario, home of the Glengarry ones
"Arid" sheets of plasterboard used in home construction
Necrolatry is the worship of this group who don't get around much anymore
The shot put & the pole vault are 2 of the events in this track & field contest
This undemocratic type of government comes from the Latin for "to say"
Directional term meaning along the flight line away from a missile launching site
This French-speaking city is 150 miles down the St. Lawrence from Montreal, at the confluence of the St. Charles
This province has 3 counties: Kings, Queens & Prince
Cape Spear, Canada's easternmost point, is a short drive from St. John's, the capital of this province
The 4th daughter of Queen Victoria lent 1 of her names to a province & another to this emerald-colored lake near Banff
This "great" lake on the Arctic circle is the largest lake entirely within Canada
Ogden Nash wrote that this explorer "discovered America and they put him in jail for it"
In "Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening", he wrote that he had "promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep"
In "The Courtship of Miles Standish", Longfellow wrote, "Youngest of all was he of the men who came in" this ship
This Poe maiden lived "in a kingdom by the sea"
This poet wrote, "next to of course god america i love you land of the pilgrims' and so forth"
Che is the word & character for vehicle: huo che, or "fire vehicle", is this transport that can take you across China
Some English names have standard Chinese versions; this gospel writer is Yuehan
The "sh" in... [Deng "Sh"iaoping] ...has no exact equivalent in English; it's usually rendered with this letter
Because Chinese makes limited use of shi as this English verb, "he very tall" perfectly acceptable
To communicate you must master the 4 of these: a tip for learning the second, rising one, is to raise your eyebrows
This word precedes "puff" in a common alliterative beauty aid
This synonym for "puff" can refer to a slight odor or a baseball strikeout
In an eye exam a puff of air is used to measure intraocular pressure, a test for this condition
From the French for "flaky", feuillete is a term for a puff this
It's a metaphor for acting proud & making yourself look big; a grouse does it literally
Jeremy Irons helps the title character connect with his dragon in this film whose title changes 1 letter in "Dragon"
In this 2010 animated film, Hiccup befriends & then teaches an injured dragon named Toothless
In this 1977 kids' movie, the title character is the only one who can see Elliott, a dragon
Christian Bale & Matthew McConaughey tag & bag flame-throwing dragons in this futuristic tale
Peter MacNicol eventually gets this title job in a 1981 movie
It's no wonder Lot's wife was changed into a pillar of salt; she & Lot lived by this "sea" that's really a lake
The ancient poet Sappho hailed from an island in this sea
If you make your home in the capital city of Hobart, you live by this sea
The fur seals of the Pribilof Islands not only live by this sea, they also live in it
A good place to play Marco Polo is in this sea that surrounds Marco Polo's city of birth
The subject of the bio "America's Queen", she was an editor at Doubleday until her 1994 death
Truman Capote said of this writer's frenzied creation of "On the Road", "that isn't writing; it's typing"
Her paperback novels like "Hollywood Wives" have been bestsellers
Pills are the dolls in the title of her trash classic "Valley of the Dolls"
This former G.E. CEO has co-authored "Straight From The Gut" & "Winning"
A fetlock is located on the back of the horse's leg & the forelock is located here
Cotton candy is also called spun this
In 2010 this Conservative leader descended from King William IV became Britain's prime minister
This "sweet"' instrument may be hammered or Appalachian
Marilyn Monroe described this actor who died in 1966 as "the only person I know who is in worse shape than I am"
The shortest of the four gospels (4)
Food from heaven (5)
Water turned to wine (7)
Jesus as the "anointed one" (7)
Noah's long-lived granddad (10)

Billy Flynn & Clifford Irving
Lon Chaney & George M. Cohan

rounds.text: His reign was interrupted for "100 days" in the 19th century before he was restored & reigned for 9 years more
